name: Arts Education Programs
description: Since 1995, ACSF has brought its dynamic cultural arts programs into a variety of communities through off-site education programs. ACSF’s performances, residency classes, and workshops serve thousands of youth each year. Their team of high-level instructors and performers offer a range of programs and can often adapt programs to meet your site’s needs. A description of arts education program options is below. ASSEMBLY PERFORMANCES High-level artists put on an awe-inspiring performance of capoeir

howToGetIt: 1. For Elementary School (K-5) enrollment visit and create an account on https://www.abada.org/youth-teen/. Parents must create a profile for themselves and the youth student. Once signed up, parents can request free or reduced-cost access on the mandatory release form. Once the form is signed, parents will be contacted via e-mail to complete enrollment steps. 2. For Teens (13-18), complete enrollment on https://www.abada.org/ray-project/ page and follow the same steps as outlined in 1. Any teen can take Teen/Adult Capoiera free of charge all year long. .
cost: Cost may vary based on pre-approved request by parents
